New Records: LeBron James scored 32 points, 14 rebounds, and 10 assists to become the fifth all-time player with 113 triple-doubles.
Key Match Events: LeBron James scored 16 points during a 21-0 Lakers run to open the 4th quarter to tilt the game back in L.A.'s favor.
Anthony Davis drained a clutch 3 with 38 seconds left to give him his third straight 30+ point game to open the season.
De’Aaron Fox scored 31 points to help the Kings lead by seven in the 4th quarter.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach JJ Redick On LeBron: “To get that performance to start the 4th for LeBron, what can you say? … It’s actually insane.”
AD’s Key To The 3-0 Start: “Minnesota, Phoenix, Sac. A tough way to start but we found a way to get it done … LeBron Raymone James.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings had the edge in the recent history of this intra-state rivalry, sweeping the season series last year and winning five straight and eight of the last nine matchups overall.
LeBron James recorded a triple-double with 32 points, 14 rebounds, and 10 assists, and Domantas Sabonis also posted a triple-double with 29 points, 12 rebounds, and 10 assists.
Others: Boston shattered the previous record held by the 2021 Knicks with 68 3-pointers made through their first three games of the season.
